ai-patthana13.16:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma, namely, Tissaka,
ai-patthana13.16:1.1_0: depends on the path, or by the path, there is no cause or condition.
ai-patthana13.16:1.1_1: depends on the path, doesn’t give rise to the cause,
ai-patthana13.16:1.1_2: It doesn’t give rise to the path, nor does relying on the path.
ai-patthana13.16:1.1_3: thoughts, etc., do not have a path, or by the path. And because of this there is no cause or condition.
ai-patthana13.16:1.1_4: Enjoying the path, or causes these things, namely, the reason for the sake of paths, and for the sake of reason.
ai-patthana13.16:1.1_5: Enjoying the path, or by causes and reasons, without reason,
ai-patthana13.16:1.1_6: Enjoying along the path, or causes; the reason for path does not arise with cause or condition.
ai-patthana13.16:1.1_7: This is the section in brief.
ai-patthana13.16:2.1_0: The thirty-six objects of the thirty-six objects ...
